channel.title: Associations :: K-State CIS 400 Textbook
channel.description: Class diagrams also express the associations between classes by drawing lines between the boxes representing them. There are two basic types of associations we model with UML: has-a and is-a associations. We break these into two further categories, based on the strength of the association, which is either strong or weak. These associations are: Association Name Association Type Realization weak is-a Generalization strong is-a Aggregation weak has-a Composition strong has-a Is-A Associations Is-a associations indicate a relationship where one class is a instance of another class.
